Feeling the pressure to propose from their girlfriends, pals Peanut and Bang decide to enjoy one last wild ride of debauchery in the big city. link.synopsis: Enjoy 32 classic silent and sound comedies that star Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle, a 266-pound man-child whose career never recovered from a scandalous rape trial in which he was found innocent. A contemporary of Charlie Chaplin and Buster Keaton -- and, in his heyday, as popular as either of them -- Arbuckle directs and stars alongside Rudolph Valentino, Harold Lloyd and a host of other silent-screen heavyweights. Films include the 45-minute short "April" (1962) as well as the feature-length Falling Leaves (1968), There Once Was a Singing Blackbird (1970) and Pastoral (1976).

link.synopsis: A World War II freighter captain is astonished when he seemingly defeats a large enemy vessel with his small steamer and its little cannon in this riotous Italian adventure-comedy directed by Wolfgang Staudte. Emboldened by his apparent victory, the skipper sets out with his crew and his undersized boat on a quest across the high seas hunting for enemy submarines. Vittorio De Sica and Nino Manfredi head the cast.

link.synopsis: Welcome to the hilarious household of the Diwan family, where naive but lovable patriarch Dadaji and his stern socialite wife, Dadiji (Sushama Seth), juggle two grown sons and their wives, grandchildren and the faithful servant. One of the warmest, wittiest family comedies ever to run on Indian television, the popular series features Navin Nischal as the responsible son, Baldev, and Shekhar Suman as the wisecracking Sameer.

link.synopsis: In Todo el Poder, a Mexico City filmmaker (Demián Bichir) takes the law into his own hands after he's victimized three times in one day. Then, in La Ley de Herodes, when a meek janitor (Damián Alcázar)  is appointed mayor of a small town, he's soon seduced by politics and corruption. This double dose of Spanish-language black comedies takes aim at the crime and corruption found south of the border.

link.synopsis: For 20 years, Inspector "Flatfoot" Rizzo (Bud Spencer) has successfully fought crime without using a gun, but when a drug ring starts peddling their wares to kids, they discover that Flatfoot still packs a helluva punch. Kicked off the police force when his fists get him in dutch, Rizzo takes matters into his own lethal hands in this Italian action-comedy. The supporting cast includes Raymond Pellegrin and Angelo Infanti.

link.synopsis: Throughout history, people have wrestled with matters of the heart, and the modern era is no exception. Who better to solve these problems than the Greek gods responsible for love, Aphrodite and her son, Eros? This charming comedy-drama from Kevin Murphy, writer and co-executive producer of "Desperate Housewives," transports the two deities to the present day, where they play matchmaker and help repair broken relationships.

Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series
The Book of Daniel: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Writer-director Kentucker Audley stars (under his given name, Andrew Nenninger) in this indie comedy-drama as Dave, a slacker who's more interested in writing songs and playing guitar than holding down a 9-to-5 job. Despite pressure from his family and an impending breakup with his ambitious girlfriend, Dave holds fast to his bohemian ways. Bill Baker, Amanda Harris and Chellie Bowman co-star in Audley's feature-length debut.
link.title: synopsis
Austin City Limits Music Festival: Live from Austin, Texas, 2005
The Work of Director Spike Jonze
The Sacrifice / Directed by Andrei Tarkovsky
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Stock car racer Blake Beckett (Pepper Sweeney) struggles with the fact that he never made it to the nationals like his father (Patrick Gorman). When his daughter (Ann Bratton) falls for a hotshot driver named Indy (Joshua Snyder), Blake sees his own lost opportunities in the young man's ability. Mathis Fender and Barbara Niven co-star as Blake's deaf race car-driving son and sympathetic wife in this heartfelt comedy-drama.
link.title: synopsis
Learn to In-Line Skate with Debbie Merrill
ESPN Ultimate NASCAR: Vol. 3: Greatest Drivers, Biggest Races, Hottest Rivalries
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Based on the popular young adult novel by Lola Douglas, this Lifetime comedy-drama stars pop singer-turned-actress Joanna "JoJo" Levesque as Morgan Carter, a Hollywood starlet known more for her club-hopping, hard-partying ways than for her talent. After a string of embarrassing incidents land her in rehab, Morgan's mother sends her to live with her aunt (Valerie Bertinelli) in Indiana, hoping the move will inspire Morgan to change her ways.
link.title: synopsis
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
A Love Song for Bobby Long
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
When Did You Last See Your Father?

title.regular: True Confessions of a Hollywood Starlet
title.short: True Confessions of a Hollywood Starlet

link.synopsis: The increasingly forgetful Nonna (Ana Ofelia Murguia) wants to make the trip from Mexico to Italy so she can visit the birthplace of her beloved late husband. Worried she won't remember the trip anyway, Nonna's family devises a scheme to grant Nonna's last wish -- only this family vacation won't exactly entail leaving home. This entertaining comedy-drama also stars Veronica Langer and Rodrigo Murray as Nonna's children, Maria and Luigi.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna

link.synopsis: Bronx brothers Frank (Gaetano Iacono) and Lou (Louis Lombardi) must learn to work together to save the family bakery after Lou's gambling debts pile up and the local mob boss gives them an ultimatum: settle up or hand over the business. As the brothers try to come up with the cash, they reflect on the life choices they've made. Lombardi also directs and co-wrote this comedy-drama, which co-stars Vincent Pastore.
link.title: synopsis
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: After years in prison, Pony Boy (Rafael Pony Boy Ochoa) is struggling to rebuild his life on the outside when he falls hard for Mira (Siboney Lo), a beautiful prostitute who confides that she's being held prisoner in a brothel -- and may be hiding a more sinister secret. Pony Boy enlists his old friend C-Note (Manuel Skribe Garcia) in a crazy scheme to rescue Mira, but soon, things take a turn for the weird in this comedy-meets-horror flick.
link.title: synopsis
Las Vegas: An Unconventional History: American Experience

You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
Desi's Looking for a New Girl
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest

link.synopsis: Director Jôji Iida's demented horror-comedy brew stars rock guitarist Pappara Kawai as Lucio Furuchi, who inadvertently turns a kotatsu heater into a slavering carnivorous menace after removing a protective seal from the seemingly ordinary appliance. When the rogue machine sets off on a bloody rampage, it's up to an eccentric electrician (Akira Emoto) -- clad in an improvised suit of power armor -- to stop the kotatsu's killing spree.

Open All Hours: The Complete Series
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai

link.synopsis: When his daughter is refused financial aid for college, professor Bruno (Manolo Ozuna) looks for ways to pay her tuition. He takes a second job at a security agency, unaware that he's really being hired as a getaway driver for the company's thieving owner. When the heist starts to fall apart, Bruno wonders if his daughter's education is worth the risk to his life. Pachy Mendéz co-stars in this action-comedy from Ángel Muñiz.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life
Cuentos De Hadas Para Dormir Cocodrilos

link.synopsis: This collection of 40 rare shorts spans the career of silent film star and forgotten funnyman Charley Chase, from his early work with Mack Sennett, to Hal Roach comedies and shorts Chase directed featuring Will Rogers, Snub Pollard and others. Among the classics here are "The Rent Jumpers," "Love, Loot and Crash," "Hard Knocks,"  "The Flirts,"  "A Ten-Minute Egg," "Should Husbands Be Watched?" and "The Courtship of Miles Sandwich."
link.title: synopsis
The Little Tramp: The Charlie Chaplin Collection

link.synopsis: The tragedies, histories and comedies of playwright William Shakespeare are some of the finest in the English language. But in this made-for-television miniseries from the 1970s, the Bard of Avon's own life offers a plot that's just as riveting. Emmy Award winner Tim Curry stars as Shakespeare, with Golden Globe winner Ian McShane co-starring as Shakespeare's fellow playwright and rival, Christopher Marlowe.
link.title: synopsis
William Shakespeare: A Life of Drama
The Shadow of the Tower: The Rise of the Tudor Dynasty
The Six Wives of Henry VIII
The Life of Leonardo Da Vinci
The Dick Francis Thriller: The Racing Game

link.synopsis: One bright-yellow Rolls Royce has three different owners in this star-studded comedy-drama with an ensemble cast that includes Ingrid Bergman, Rex Harrison, Shirley MacLaine, George C. Scott, Omar Sharif, Art Carney, Jeanne Moreau and Alain Delon. Presented as a progression of three stories, the film earned a Golden Globe nod for Best Original Score, ultimately winning the award for Best Original Song ("Forget Domani").
link.title: synopsis
The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines

link.synopsis: When they discover that their favorite comic book is being used by a gang of crooks (led by Jack Warner) to pass coded messages to each other, a group of young East Enders bands together with the book's author (Alastair Sim) to foil the criminal plots. Regarded as the first of the famed "Ealing Comedies," director Charles Crichton's 1947 film is noted for featuring several London locations ravaged by World War II bombings.

Siege of Sidney Street / The Frightened Man

link.synopsis: Based on a popular Japanese manga, this pair of sidesplitting live action comedies follows the screwball exploits of a host of unconventional participants in the ferociously intense world of competitive eating. While most people try to temper their food intake, these competitors pride themselves on swallowing as much food as they can in the shortest possible time -- and keeping it down long enough to win!

link.synopsis: Shaken by the apparent food-poisoning death of a customer, chef and restaurateur Gus (David La Haye) undertakes a pilgrimage to Thailand, where a mysterious woman shares with him the otherworldly secrets of Thai cooking. But when Gus returns to Montreal, he discovers that the cooking secrets he thought were a blessing may be a terrible curse. Hunt Hoe directs this supernatural horror-comedy hybrid that co-stars Napakpapha Nakprasitte.

link.synopsis: In this big-screen adaptation of the beloved Frank O. King comic strip, half-brothers Corky (Scotty Beckett) and Skeezix (Jimmy Lydon) end up running a restaurant where family disagreements seem to be the main course. Next, Joe Sawyer and William Tracy star in a service-comedy double feature, in which Tracy reprises his famed role of Sgt. Dorian "Dodo" Doubleday, a soldier with a photographic memory.

link.synopsis: Manu wants his mother to come to the United States and live with his family, but they both know his bossy wife, Lily, would never allow it. Then, Manu's mother devises an ingenious plan: She'll disguise herself as a maid and work at her son's house. Unfortunately, Lily is none too fond of the family's new addition. Directed by Manoj Shah, this comedy-drama stars Kalpana Diwan, Rajul Diwan, Sachi Joshi, Niyati Joshi, Karan Mehta and Jyotika Shah.

link.synopsis: The seasoned vaudeville expertise of funnyman Ed Wynn is on full display in these four episodes from the performer's Emmy-winning TV series from 1949 and 1950, featuring top Hollywood talent of the day. In this collection, Wynn welcomes to the show special guests Oscar-winning actress Celeste Holm (Gentlemen's Agreement), Hollywood's "Oomph Girl" Ann Sheridan, Bride of Frankenstein star Elsa Lanchester and silent-comedy pioneer Buster Keaton.

link.synopsis: A shy student (Jason Dolley) loses his inhibitions and finds newfound freedom -- inside a chicken mascot suit -- while a neglected teen girl (Emily Osment) channels her inner superspy to rescue her famous dad in this pair of family-friendly comedies from Disney. It's all about tapping into your alter ego with this wacky double bill that co-stars Disney Channel favorites Mitchel Musso, Jason Earles, Tiffany Thornton, David Henrie and Moises Arias.

link.synopsis: There's no harm in dreaming big, but heading to America to become the next hot boy band when you're pushing 40 and not exactly movie-star handsome? That's just madness -- or so everyone thinks when the Berlin Brothers set off on their quest. Against all odds, however, they do succeed ... but at what price? That's the central question in this road film/comedy from Marcus Mittermeier and Jan Henrik Stahlberg (who also co-star).

link.synopsis: When beauty queen Natalia (Marjorie De Sousa) moves to Miami in the hopes of launching a modeling career, she finds an ally in fashion executive Esteban (Víctor González) -- and a rival in Esteban's ex, a jealous supermodel named Vanessa (Evelyn Santos) -- in this telenovela-style comedy-drama. As she navigates the rocky runway to fame, Natalia encounters cutthroat competition, less-than-glamorous gigs … and a little romance.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd

link.synopsis: When strip club owner Joe (Carmine Capobianco) and manicure artist Kate (Debi Thibeault) discover they have a mutual interest in slicing and dicing hapless victims, it's love at first site, and soon the pair are off on a happy killing spree. But when one victim's parts clog up their garbage disposal, they call in a plumber, who blackmails the lovebirds into providing him with fresh bodies to cannibalize. Gorman Bechard directs this horror-comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Answer the Phone / Prime Evil

link.synopsis: The lives of two men intersect in this comedy-drama from writer-director Darko Lungulov. Serbian immigrant Branko (Branislav Trifunovic) wants his girlfriend, Ivana (Jelena Mrdja), to come live in America, while struggling New York musician Robert (David Thornton) desperately needs money. Robert agrees to travel to Belgrade to marry Ivana, but during the course of his chaotic trip, he encounters plenty of surprises. Pop icon Cyndi Lauper co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
How to Make Love to a Woman
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: Perennial wallflower Henry (Sverrir Gudnason) hopes to spice up his life by moving to Spain and opening a restaurant with a friend (David Dencik). But just as he's about to leave, things begin to get interesting -- thanks, in part, to a punked-out feminist stripper named Marie (Tuva Novotny). A stash of steroids, a mentally ill mother and an excursion to IKEA round out this quirky comedy-drama from filmmakers Alexander Brøndsted and Antonio Tublén.

link.synopsis: Nick Frost, Ben Crompton, Amanda Abbington, Nicholas Burns and other talented cast members deliver plenty of laughs in this British sketch-comedy show that's chock full of inappropriate behavior, awkward situations and brutally honest confessions. This second season features a married couple's ill-fated role-playing adventures, an office manager's misguided attempts to soothe her staff and a terminally ill girl's outlandish last wish.

link.synopsis: Chris Lemmon narrates this intimate biographical portrait of his father, two-time Oscar-winning actor Jack Lemmon, that features revealing interviews with Lemmon's closest friends and colleagues as well as rarely seen personal photographs. The documentary was originally released as part of The Jack Lemmon Film Collection, which presents five of Lemmon's best-loved Columbia Pictures comedies.

link.synopsis: Discover how six seemingly ordinary but supremely talented men became Monty Python, sketch comedy's inspired group of lunatics who turned such unlikely sources of inspiration as Spam, dead parrots and the Inquisition into enduring punch lines. This entertaining documentary includes interviews with members of the troupe, as well as home movies, photos and rare recordings from Monty Python's early years.

link.synopsis: After Parisian Jerome catches his boyfriend with another guy, he heads to Hollywood to create a new life for himself in this charming comedy-drama. Soon, he finds himself in an always-sunny world full of quirky Los Angeles natives. But as he pursues his dream of becoming a star, Jerome learns some unexpected lessons about love and friendship. Written and directed by Jason Bushman, the film stars Eric Debets and Chad Allen.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: Helmed by directors Alexander Hall and Richard Wallace, this pair of charming screwball comedies stars silver-screen beauty Loretta Young, alongside Ray Milland, Brian Aherne and Sidney Toler. In the first, a feminist author (Young) and a sexist MD (Milland) pose as husband and wife to improve their public personas. In the second, a mystery writer (Aherne) moves into a shady apartment in search of inspiration and gets more than he bargained for.
